feedback.Physical object: Included — A tangible object occupying space and observable via its magnetic effects.
feedback.Man-made / synthetic: Included — Most magnets are industrially produced.
feedback.Biological or biologically-inspired: Excluded — Not derived from or imitative of biological systems.
feedback.Fixed/static: Included — Maintains polarity and shape unless physically altered.
feedback.Structural: Excluded — Not used as a load-bearing or architectural frame.
feedback.Perceptible: Included — Perceivable directly (shape, texture) and indirectly (magnetic force).
feedback.Material form: Included — Composed of ferromagnetic substances like iron or neodymium.
feedback.Passive: Excluded — Actively emits a magnetic field; not behaviorally inert.
feedback.Purposeful / intentional: Included — Designed or selected to attract, hold, or actuate objects.
feedback.Emits output / produces effect: Included — Emits a magnetic field with detectable force.
feedback.Processes or regulates logic/signals: Excluded — Not a logic processor or signal controller by itself.
feedback.Transforms or modifies internal state: Excluded — Magnetic state remains fixed unless externally altered.
feedback.Interacts with humans directly: Included — Grasped, used, or positioned by hand in everyday applications.
feedback.Part of a larger system: Included — Commonly found in motors, sensors, locks, or devices.
feedback.Autonomous in function: Included — Once magnetized, operates independently without further input.
feedback.System-critical: Excluded — Not universally critical to any system (e.g., not required in all machines).
feedback.Symbolic / representational: Excluded — Not inherently representative or metaphorical.
feedback.Communicative: Excluded — Does not transmit or encode meaning or information.
feedback.Logical / rule-based: Included — Magnetic behavior obeys deterministic physical laws (e.g., Maxwell’s equations).
feedback.Hierarchical / modular: Excluded — Not composed of distinct subunits or functional layers.
feedback.Behavior-guiding: Excluded — Does not alter human behavior in a directive or regulatory way.
feedback.Self-referential / meta-conceptual: Excluded — Lacks abstract recursion or self-modeling.
feedback.Temporal: Excluded — Magnetic fields are persistent; time plays no intrinsic role.
feedback.Contextual abstraction: Excluded — Its meaning and use are consistent across domains.
feedback.Socially / culturally constructed: Excluded — Exists independently of human classification systems.
feedback.Defined by a group/system: Excluded — Not defined or governed by collective human rules.
feedback.Linked to identity or role: Excluded — Magnets are not identity markers or social role indicators.
feedback.Regulated / governed: Excluded — Not regulated as a class of objects (though some uses might be).
feedback.Teachable / transmissible: Included — Magnetic theory is widely taught in science education.
feedback.Visible: Included — The magnet itself is visible, even if its field is not.
feedback.Context-sensitive: Excluded — Identity and function remain constant regardless of setting.
feedback.Widely known: Included — Universally recognized object with clear public familiarity.
